entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as a character in the text who has anger and contempt in his voice.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is mentioned as a character in the text who is being addressed by Charity Burbage.

entities.name: charity burbage
entities.description: Charity Burbage is mentioned as a character in the text who is defending Mudbloods and writing an impassioned defense in the Daily Prophet.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: Malfoy's wand is being used by Voldemort to silence Charity Burbage.

entities.name: mudbloods
entities.description: Mudbloods are mentioned as a group that Professor Burbage is defending in the text.

entities.name: purebloods
entities.description: Purebloods are mentioned as a group whose dwindling is considered desirable by Professor Burbage.

entities.name: muggles
entities.description: Muggles are mentioned as a group that Wizards must accept and learn from according to Professor Burbage.

entities.name: daily prophet
entities.description: The Daily Prophet is mentioned as the publication where Professor Burbage wrote an impassioned defense of Mudbloods.

relationships.description: Voldemort addresses Snape in the text.
Charity Burbage addresses Snape in the text.
Voldemort uses Malfoy's wand to silence Charity Burbage.
Charity Burbage defends Mudbloods in the text.
Voldemort opposes the dwindling of purebloods according to the text.
Charity Burbage's defense of Mudbloods is published in the Daily Prophet.
